Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:

  • Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
  • Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
  • Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:

  • A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
  • English fluency;
  • Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
  • Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
  • Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
  • have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
  • preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.

Your Advantages

  • A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
  • Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
  • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
  • Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
  • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
  • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
  • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
  • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
  • Subsidized company restaurant;
  • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Title: Data Scientist AI
Description:
Mission context




The Tribe AI’s objective is to leverage data science use cases to create value for the bank. The use cases can come from any department of the Bank, for instance: Robotics, Compliance, Client service center,Marketing, Sales, ...

We are looking for an external consultant who can help us to use new generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve our employee productivity and efficiency in our standard activities. The consultant will work with different business users from different parts of the bank, such as marketing, sales, and back office, and with different profiles, such as managers, project managers, sales people, etc.




Function description




Design and create the prompts that can elicit the best responses from the generative AI tools, using prompt engineering techniques and best practices
Understand the business needs: Identify the use cases, the business need and scenarios where our generative AI tools can add value and solve problems
Test and evaluate the quality and accuracy of the generative AI tools' outputs, using appropriate metrics and feedback mechanisms
Train and coach the business users on how to use the
generative AI tools e􀆯ectively and responsibly and begin to set in place a prompt academy
Document and communicate the results and learnings of the project




Language requirements




Dutch Fluent
French Fluent
English Fluent




Education

You have at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, mathematics, engineering (a PhD is considered an advantage) or MBA.
Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial knowledge of prompt engineering technics are also encouraged to apply.




Required experience/ knowledge

You have at least 3 years of relevant experience in Data Science and

Analytics.




Technical experience




Deep knowledge of generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, etc and Microsoft Office CoPilot, and their underlying principles of large language models
Strong experience in advanced prompt engineering, including designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts for different tasks and domains
Microsoft Office Copilot + Copilot ChatGPT, Gemini, ...




Business experience




Business understanding and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and vice versa
Communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to explain complex concepts and results in a clear and concise manner
Language skills, with fluency in French, Dutch, and English preferable Financial sector




Soft skills

Team player
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Good Communication and Influencing skills
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Ability to work in a dynamic and multi-cultural environment
Thinks out of the box outside existing processes and frameworks.
Works with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success
Constructive by being open to the changes and to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback

Title: Data Scientist (Junior / Mid-Level)
Description:
About emma

emma is an end-to-end platform for cloud management, combining a cloud-agnostic approach with comprehensive AI-powered capabilities to enhance infrastructure performance and optimize costs. With emma, organizations can seamlessly navigate between different cloud providers and environments, unlocking the full potential of their cloud investments.




Role Overview

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and work on developing and improving analytical models for building forecasts and recommendations for our clients using cloud infrastructure. In this role, you will focus on time series analysis, forecasting, segmentation, and clustering. You will also be responsible for designing and implementing models for anomaly detection and recommendation systems. The position requires strong data analysis skills and a solid understanding of machine learning techniques to solve complex challenges related to cloud resource efficiency and cost optimization.




Required Skills

2-3 years of experience
Experience with Python and data analysis libraries (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).
Hands-on knowledge of deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras).
Solid understanding of ML techniques, time series analysis, clustering, and forecasting.
Proficiency in SQL and databases (ClickHouse, PostgreSQL, Greenplum).
Ability to handle large datasets efficiently.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with time series forecasting tools (statsmodels, Prophet, sktime).
Familiarity with anomaly detection libraries (PyOD, Isolation Forest, LOF).
Knowledge of recommendation system frameworks (Surprise, Implicit, LightFM).
Experience with cloud platforms and big data technologies.
Background in ML-driven projects and analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Brussels - Freelance




We are looking for a Data scientist to support FME data flows related to asset management. The role involves processing, analyzing, and managing large datasets using FME software and SQL. The candidate will work in a small team, collaborating closely to develop and implement data solutions. The data comes from various applications and is ultimately stored in a SQL Server environment.




Experience required:

Experience working in an Agile team
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python
Basic knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems)
Experience in optimizing/tuning databases and queries
Experience with FME
Experience in analyzing data flows
Experience with SQL Server
Experience in data analysis
Proficiency in Dutch at CEFR level C2
Experience with databases (SQL, Oracle)
Experience with scripting (Shell, Perl, Python)

Working Arrangement:




12 month B2B contract freelance

Hybrid working

Day rate

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
The mission of Predictive Analytics team within Marketing and Communication department is to develop, deploy and support usage of AI models to increase the reach and relevance of the campaigns.




As ML Engineer you will manage the data science ecosystem of the team to build and run our models (Domino Data Science Platform), setup data preparation pipelines, assure and monitor the quality of data sources used to generate indicators, run and monitor the performance of the models.




Function description

The Predictive Analytics team is looking for a Machine Learning (DevOps) Engineer with a proven track record on developing and deploying data science models in python environment as well as experience in data engineering.




You are part of data science team and will work on the following:




Manage the execution and quality assurance of the monthly production run from data preparation, scoring and validation of different AI models and analytical indicators. Improve the automation of this process to make it more efficient
Maintain and improve the existing python programs for collecting and validating data from different sources, for building, scoring, and performance monitoring of AI models of the team (e.g. python version upgrades)
Interface between data scientists and IT to support the usage of the Domino Data Science Platform, the AI building blocks and the evolution of the python environment.
Assist data scientist by helping them identify and install the correct dependencies in their environment, best practices for code quality, continuous improvement and automation
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering), automatic refit of the data science models
Explore new ways of combining the available tools of the bank (AI building blocks from Tribe AI) to unlock new capabilities for building AI products and supporting the data scientists.
Work with a team of motivated data scientists who are eager to learn, collaborate and share expertise.




Telework

50% on-site, 50% telework




Language requirements

English

You have fluent knowledge of English (spoken and written)

Dutch/French

Fluent/Good level of Dutch (French is a plus)

Education

You have a degree in a quantitative field (e.g Master in computer sciences)

Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science, ML DevOps are also encouraged to apply.




Required experience / knowledge

You have at least 3 years of relevant experience.




Mandatory

Strong expertise in software development in Python and Python data science packages (pandas, sklearn)
Git
bash
SQL
Experience in MLOps / DevOps




preferable

SAS
Domino Data Science Platform
Django
software testing
experience in containerization (docker)
experience in Cloud environments




Business experience

preferable

Marketing and communication




Soft skills

Team player, good communication and presentation skills
Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude
Result driven
Analytical and problem solving mindset
Autonomy, commitment and perseverance
Passionate about continuous improvement

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Young Grad ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

About Devoteam:

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals. Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services.

For 30 years, we have always been on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.

With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe

At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.

Change is Our Middle Name:

Change management is key to everything we do. It's part of our Workspace projects, Google Cloud migrations, and Data projects. We make sure that any company changes are driven by what users actually need and that everyone's on the same page. We support users throughout the whole process and train them so they can crush it. We use the ADKAR model because it's practical and based on evidence. 💯


Job Description

Devoteam Belgium is looking for a highly motivated and talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our Google Cloud.

As an ML Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work on the constantly evolving and thrilling field that is artificial intelligence, driving innovation and real world impact through state-of-the-art technologies.


Qualifications

The ML Engineer will be responsible for designing, building, and deploying machine learning models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). This role involves utilising advanced ML techniques to solve complex business problems and leverage the power of cloud computing for scalability and efficiency.

With the recent Generative AI boom, one of the main activities of your work will consist specifically in building AI Agents that integrate with various tools/platforms to bring LLM capabilities to an enterprise level.

Technologies

Vertex AI, Docker, Kubeflow, Terraform, Python, Golang


Additional Information

What We Offer:

Make a Real Impact: Be part of projects that change the game for businesses in different industries. 🏆
Work with Cutting-Edge Tech: Dive into the world of Google tools and work with experts. 💻
Level Up Fast: Learn in a fast-paced environment, get ongoing training, and have mentors who are experienced consultants. 🚀
Thrive in a Supportive Culture: Join a passionate and collaborative team where your ideas matter and your contributions are celebrated. 🎉
Enjoy Sweet Rewards: A competitive salary package with benefits including a company car, health insurance, and more. 🎁
Become Part of the Devoteam Fam: Join a dynamic and supportive community where you can connect, collaborate, and grow. 💖



Ready to Drive Change and Shape the Future of Business? Apply Now and Join Devoteam G Cloud! 🎉

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: ML Engineer for Automating the Scientific Research Process




Company: novali / Sc.AI




Location: Tildonk, Belgium (nearby Leuven and Brussels). Remote possible.




About novali: novali is a battery technology startup at the forefront of developing next-generation battery cells. Our mission is to revolutionize energy storage through cutting-edge material science.




Website: www.novali.energy




Within novali you will work specifically on Sc.AI, an AI-platform aiming to automate the scientific research process accelerating the discovery and valorization of scientific breakthroughs.




Website: www.projectsc.ai




Position Overview: As a ML Engineer, you will lead the development of an AI aimed at automating the scientific research process. This role places you at the intersection of physics, chemistry, material science, computer science, and artificial intelligence, offering a unique opportunity to innovate and impact an array of industries. You will be a key contributor to the recently approved FULL-MAP project, a €20 million Horizon Europe research project involving over 30 industry and academic partners across Europe.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop advanced AI-driven tools to automate scientific research processes with a first application in battery materials and cell technology.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams of chemists, material scientists, and AI researchers to align platform functionalities.
Leverage machine learning techniques to create innovative solutions for data analysis and modeling.
Contribute to the FULL-MAP project’s objectives and maintain strong collaboration with European partners.
Stay updated on advancements in artificial intelligence to integrate cutting-edge techniques.




Qualifications:

Masters, PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Engineering, Material Science, Physics, Chemistry, or a related field.
Proven expertise in researching, implementing, and applying machine learning.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of successful project delivery.




What We Offer:

A pivotal role in an early-stage technology startup driving innovation through disruptive technology.
Opportunities to work on groundbreaking projects and collaborate with leading industry and academic partners across Europe.
A dynamic work environment fostering professional growth and creativity.




How to Apply: Please send your CV to r.demeyer@novali.energy or contact us on LinkedIn




Show more

Job Title: ML Engineer for Automating the Scientific Research Process


Company: novali / Sc.AI


Location: Tildonk, Belgium (nearby Leuven and Brussels). Remote possible.


About novali: novali is a battery technology startup at the forefront of developing next-generation battery cells. Our mission is to revolutionize energy storage through cutting-edge material science.


Website: www.novali.energy


Within novali you will work specifically on Sc.AI, an AI-platform aiming to automate the scientific research process accelerating the discovery and valorization of scientific breakthroughs.


Website: www.projectsc.ai


Position Overview: As a ML Engineer, you will lead the development of an AI aimed at automating the scientific research process. This role places you at the intersection of physics, chemistry, material science, computer science, and artificial intelligence, offering a unique opportunity to innovate and impact an array of industries. You will be a key contributor to the recently approved FULL-MAP project, a €20 million Horizon Europe research project involving over 30 industry and academic partners across Europe.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop advanced AI-driven tools to automate scientific research processes with a first application in battery materials and cell technology.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams of chemists, material scientists, and AI researchers to align platform functionalities.
  • Leverage machine learning techniques to create innovative solutions for data analysis and modeling.
  • Contribute to the FULL-MAP project’s objectives and maintain strong collaboration with European partners.
  • Stay updated on advancements in artificial intelligence to integrate cutting-edge techniques.


Qualifications:

  • Masters, PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Engineering, Material Science, Physics, Chemistry, or a related field.
  • Proven expertise in researching, implementing, and applying machine learning.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of successful project delivery.


What We Offer:

  • A pivotal role in an early-stage technology startup driving innovation through disruptive technology.
  • Opportunities to work on groundbreaking projects and collaborate with leading industry and academic partners across Europe.
  • A dynamic work environment fostering professional growth and creativity.


How to Apply: Please send your CV to r.demeyer@novali.energy or contact us on LinkedIn

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join my client in Belgium on a payroll basis.




The ideal candidate will have knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Java (Spring Boot).




**This position is also open to fully remote candidates based in the CET time-zone**




Your Role:

Architect and Develop ML Integration: Design and implement the software architecture for machine learning integration within the product.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders (product owners, data scientists, architects, front-end engineers) to align user requirements and standards with technical specifications and integration strategies.
Back-End Oversight: Lead the design and review of back-end systems, including data access layers, ensuring seamless functionality and scalability.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging tech (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Azure ML) to refine back-end architecture and enhance ML integration capabilities.







Required Skills:

Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience in software architecture and engineering.
Skilled in Python and Java (Spring Boot).
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and OOP.
Proficient in machine learning concepts and tools.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and RESTful API design.
Work Environment: Agile/Scrum experience with a collaborative mindset.
Communication: Clear articulation of technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




The Offer:

What We Offer:

Exciting Opportunities: Be part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the industrial analytics space, working with a global team of experts in data science, software engineering, and industrial automation.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, benefits package, and a company car or mobility budget.
Top-Tier Equipment: Developer laptop (MacBook Pro).
Flexibility: Work remotely up to 60% or fully remote if outside Belgium, with flexible working hours and a strong focus on work/life balance.
Prime Location: Access to a modern office at the Corda Campus in Hasselt.
Career Growth: Expand your skills and advance your career in a fast-expanding company with state-of-the-art tools and a visionary approach.
Supportive Environment: Collaborative, open-minded culture that encourages personal and professional development.
Learning Opportunities: Personal learning and development budget, company-managed, and external training opportunities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge tech with cinematic magic.




Position: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Remote in Europe

Salary up to $90,000




You will build and deploy AI models that power groundbreaking filmmaking tools. Collaborate globally, code with precision, and drive innovation through data-driven testing.




Role:

Craft robust and efficient machine learning pipelines tailored for filmmaking applications.
Deliver clean, well-documented, and maintainable Python code.
Conduct rigorous A/B testing and performance analysis to optimize models and ensure they meet key metrics.
Ensure models are deployed effectively in production environments, leveraging cloud services and containerization.




Qualifications:

Deep Python/PyTorch expertise
3+ years relevant ML experience
Experienced with 3D Mesh
Big bonus if you have GenAI Experience i.e. Flux, Stable Diffusion

Title: ⚙️ Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.

The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

What You'll Find At Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].

What We’re Looking For


You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You’re familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you’re very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You’ve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you’re aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn’t scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,…)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.


This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us

The Offer


An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.

Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!
Show more

    • Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
    • Hospitalization and group insurance
    • High-end laptop
    • Smartphone with subscription
    • Substantial amount of holidays
    • Meal vouchers
    • ...

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)Starting Pay / Salary Range

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ALTEN Belgium is a leading player in the fields of Engineering, Life Sciences and Information Technology, where people and innovation are at the heart of everything we do. In our open and dynamic organization, we empower our ambitious employees to unlock their full potential and thrive professionally.




We achieve this by offering them exciting projects and continuous development opportunities through the ALTEN Academy and our knowledge-sharing events. Our employees are part of a vast network of expertise, extending even internationally. This way, we foster individual growth while delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients.




Context

In this role, you’ll help lead innovation in machine-learning techniques for driving and vehicle monitoring. You’ll be responsible for creating a machine-learning model that monitors and analyses time series data in real-time. As part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team, you'll collaborate with researchers and engineers to integrate and optimize the model. If you’re a collaborative problem-solver with a strong background in time series and deep learning, and you're passionate about motorsport and automotive technology, this is the perfect opportunity for you to make an impact.




Expertise

Expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning, including familiarity with classical algorithms
Knowledge of foundation models, including large vision models and multi-modal models
Experience with time series analysis (experience with large real-time data is a plus)
(Preferred) Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and deploying deep neural networks in practical applications
(Preferred) Experience in integrating algorithms and conducting testing in real-world settings (e.g., embedded devices and cloud infrastructure)




Technical

Proficient in Python, with additional knowledge of C++ and MATLAB/Simulink
Strong expertise in PyTorch (experience with PyTorch Forecasting and TensorRT is a plus)
Familiarity with Python libraries such as Pandas and Scikit-learn (experience with SKTime and Darts is a bonus)
Skilled in Linux, Docker, and Git
Experienced in working with Linux environments and High-Performance Computing (HPC), preferably with AWS and Azure
(Optional) Experience with embedded architecture, specifically Nvidia Jetson




Tasks

Design, assess, and refine algorithms from the time series literature
Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in foundation models and time series analysis
Implement algorithms and manage the code repository
Work closely with researchers and engineers to train, test, and evaluate the model
Develop and support demonstrations with real systems and prepare for field tests
Present findings during regular project meetings and prepare results for publication




If you are interested, don't hesitate to apply!




Note: We are only hiring candidates authorized to work in Belgium without needing visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Akkodis is looking for a skilled Data Scientist for a prominent client in the automotive industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to develop and deploy data analytics solutions across business units at a pan-European level.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyze and preprocess large datasets using Python and SQL to derive actionable insights.
Develop and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, anomaly detection algorithms, and optimization scripts.
Validate and interpret results using statistical methodologies.
Visualize data and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.




Qualifications:




Master’s degree in Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics (Computer Science degree is a plus).
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist, with expertise in machine learning, optimization, time series forecasting, and recommender systems.
Proficient in Python and SQL; experience with the Dataiku DSS platform is a must (required certifications).
Familiarity with the Snowflake cloud data warehouse platform.
Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication skills.




Traits We Value:




Intellectual curiosity and a creative approach to problem-solving.
Ability to summarize progress visually and communicate complex concepts simply.
A proactive team player who can adapt to new ways of working.

Traits We Value:


  • Intellectual curiosity and a creative approach to problem-solving.
  • Ability to summarize progress visually and communicate complex concepts simply.
  • A proactive team player who can adapt to new ways of working.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


, ING Bank

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do


You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).


About You


You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English


Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Company: Better Placed Ltd - A Sunday Times Top 10 Employer!
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Up to €75,000

Remote – UK or EU based







I'm working with an AI start up that specialises in integrating AI into manufacturing processes. This is an industry ripe for tech innovation and their AI product is adding some real value with several large companies already using it




You'll be working on getting their AI product perfected and getting stuck into their LLMs and ML systems. This role is a blend of Machine Learning and Data Science with the chance to work with an experienced team of engineers.




This is a global team distributed around the world who are really making an impact in their niche utilization of AI.




What you’ll do:




• Develop and optimize RAG pipelines to enhance LLM-driven troubleshooting.




• Work with PyVector to store and retrieve relevant data efficiently.




• Implement vector embedding models to power retrieval and improve accuracy.




• Deploy and scale models on AWS




• Fine-tune and evaluate LLMs for task-specific reasoning andaccuracy.




• Learn and progress your career in an established team of global experts




What you’ll need:




• 1- 3 years commercial experience, mid-level or junior looking to step up




• A Bachelors or Masters from a top University.




• Solid Python development skills, with experience in machine learning




• Experience with RAG architectures and knowledge retrieval techniques.




• Familiarity with PyVector for vector search and retrieval.




• Experience using vectorembedding models




• Experience working with AWS for cloud-based ML deployment.




• Knowledge of LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other RAG frameworks.




The key to the role would be RAG and cloud deployment experience!




If you’re looking to work for a unique AI start up that is disrupting a typically antiquated industry with a cutting edge product then apply with your CV or reach out directly to Ben Greensmith.

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Research Scientist (Jr)
Description:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium




Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.




Your Responsibilities

Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.




Required Skills

Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).




Soft Skills

Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.




Application Requirements

CV highlighting:
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
HTML:
Please carefully read the job description before applying. Only shortlisted candidates who meet the requirements will be contacted.


DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS:

AI solution analysis, design and implementation in close coordination with team management and AI technical lead;

Propose adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;

Deliver AI and ML training to technical and non-technical (business) users ;

Communicate project results in a clear, modern and easy to understand manner geared towards business (non-IT) users;

Data modelling in the context of data science and AI;

Creation of industrial solutions to exploit data science and AI solutions;

Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;

Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyse business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;

Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management upon request.

Required skills:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage;
  • Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI and Machine Learning (statistical) models;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g. Data Services, Talend etc);
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;
  • Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.



Delivery mode: Near-site (Brussels)

Deadline: 17/03/2025 at 11:30 AM (CET)

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
B.E.S. (Business & Engineering Solutions) is growing and thus welcoming new AI Research Engineer in our Automotive team.




As a AI Research Engineer at B.E.S., you will enjoy a collaborative environment where you will work closely with others in an organisation focused on innovation.




Your responsibilities:




Develop and optimize machine learning algorithms for time series data.
Stay updated on advancements in foundation models and time series analysis.
Implement, test, and maintain machine learning models and code repositories.
Collaborate with researchers and engineers in the automotive sector for model training and evaluation.
Support field tests and demonstrations with actual systems.
Integrate algorithms into embedded devices and cloud infrastructures.
Contribute to deployment and continuous integration of models in real-world environments.
Travel for collaborative work and testing between locations.




Your profile:




You have a background in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or Mathematics.
You have 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.
You have a research-driven mindset, with at least a Master’s degree (PhD preferred).
You are practical and you have a hands-on approach focused on solving real-world challenges.
You are a highly self-motivated, and skilled at juggling multiple tasks with ease. You are always eager to learn and grow.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills,
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge,
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances, OR a freelance contract,
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team!

Show more
