Title: Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)
Description:
📢 We are looking for an Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)!

We are seeking a highly skilled Artificial Intelligence Expert specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and AI-driven solutions using Large Language Models (LLMs) for HR and Document Management applications. This role is part of the Architect Office (AO), which oversees and coordinates technical and business architecture-related activities. The position is remote, based in Europe (far-site).

📍 Location: Europe (Remote – Far-site)

📆 Start Date: Immediate

💼 Experience: Expertise in AI/ML/NLP solutions and cloud-based architectures

What Will You Do?

✅ Develop and maintain AI-powered software applications in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI).

✅ Design and optimize machine learning systems and deep learning architectures.

✅ Integrate AI/ML solutions into existing products and processes in collaboration with cross-functional teams.

✅ Architect and implement AI solutions, ensuring compliance with master- and meta-data management principles.

✅ Conduct data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation to enhance AI performance.

✅ Stay up-to-date with AI/ML advancements, adopting state-of-the-art algorithms and technologies.

✅ Manage and maintain AI solutions deployed on SaaS platforms (AWS, Azure).

✅ Document architectural blueprints and align business requirements with AI-driven capabilities.

The candidate will report to the Architect Office (AO) and project managers, following SAFe methodology and sprint-based planning.

Requirements:

Requirements & Skills:

✨ Proven ability to develop Large Language Models (LLMs), text embeddings, tokenization, and vectorization.

✨ Strong expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning architectures.

✨ Hands-on experience with Python, Java, Containers (Docker/Kubernetes), and Cloud AI services (AWS, Azure).

✨ Deep understanding of NLP systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies.

✨ Knowledge of quality assurance and control for machine translation (MT), including testing methodologies and evaluation metrics (BLEU scores and similar).

✨ Strong problem-solving, analytical, and technical writing skills.

✨ Ability to conduct proof of concepts (PoC) efficiently and effectively.

✨ Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications & Certifications:

✅ AWS Certified Machine Learning / Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Data Analytics / Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Solutions Architect / Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert.

Additional Requirements for Large International Organizations:

🌍 Ability to integrate into an international, multicultural environment and work in multilingual settings.

🤝 Strong team player with experience working on large-scale projects.

📝 High degree of discretion and integrity, as the managed applications contain confidential and personal data.

🗣 Fluent English (C1/C2) is mandatory; French (B1/B2) is an advantage.

Why Join Us?

🚀 Work on cutting-edge AI/NLP/ML solutions in a highly innovative and technical environment.

🌍 Remote opportunity within a highly collaborative and multicultural team.

💡 Be part of an international transformation program, driving AI-powered solutions for HR and Document Management.

💼 Competitive salary, career growth opportunities, and involvement in AI-driven digital transformation projects.

📩 Apply now or send your resume to jobs@sapindex.es and be part of the AI revolution! 🚀

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is seeking AI/ML Engineers with expertise in computer vision and image processing. They are a heavily funded and ambitious AI start-up based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.




The ideal candidate will develop and optimize deep learning models / VLMs for object detection, segmentation, classification, text extraction, and fine-tuning for domain-specific applications.




My client is seeking top talent globally, ideally they are looking for candidates from tier 1 or equivalent companies and top education backgrounds.




You will be integral to developing industry-leading AI software driven by cutting-edge research. You will have the opportunity to design, implement, and deploy innovative software solutions in a fast-paced environment while working alongside ex tech-giant professionals from the likes of Amazon, Meta, Google DeepMind, McKinsey and Microsoft.




Alongside your tax-free salary you will be offered a region leading benefits package including:




A months salary to cover relocation costs for you and your family.
Education allowance for up to 3 children (private schooling).
Annual flight home for you + family.
Private healthcare for you + family.
Accommodation for a month on arrival.
Annual 25% bonus.




To discover more, apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75
Show more

  • Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
  • We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
  • We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
  • In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
  • Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
  • Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
  • Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!

Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Python)
Description:
Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for machine learning and predictive analytics? Do you thrive on building models that drive real business impact, optimizing processes, and uncovering insights from complex datasets? Are you both detail-oriented and capable of seeing the bigger picture? If you’re looking to apply your ML expertise in a fast-growing and dynamic company, we want to hear from you!

At eCarsTrade, we value innovation, analytical thinking, and a results-driven mindset. In return, we offer flexibility, competitive incentives, and an environment for professional growth.




Responsibilities

Develop and maintain predictive models to estimate used car market prices, customer willingness-to-pay, supplier acceptance prices, lead time etc...
Design, implement, and maintain analytical and ML microservices using Python.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Sales, and Engineering) to identify business needs and model opportunities.
Identify and correct inaccuracies in car data (e.g., missing features, incorrect attributes).
Build recommendation engines to suggest optimal auction strategies and vehicle pricing.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience building and deploying end-to-end ML models and analytical solutions.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects with minimal supervision.
Experience building and maintaining microservices (e.g., using Flask, FastAPI, or similar frameworks).
Strong Python coding skills, including experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, and possibly PySpark.
Deep understanding of regression, classification, time-series forecasting, and clustering methods.
Strong communication and presentation skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Nice-to-Have

Experience in automotive or auction-based industries.
Experience with ML lifecycle and MLOps (model versioning, CI/CD pipelines for ML).




Please send your CV to jobs@eCarsTrade.com

Show more

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.




🤖 The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.




At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.




We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You’re familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you’re very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You’ve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you’re aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn’t scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,…)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.




This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us 🤝




💰 The Offer

+ An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...

+ Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.

+ Opportunities for individual training and team learning.

+ Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer | Relocation to Abu Dhabi | Highly Competitive Salary




Are you ready to push the boundaries of AI and work on cutting-edge machine learning models? We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join an elite team driving innovation in AI. This role is for those who thrive on solving complex challenges, leveraging LLMs, RAG, and Generative AI, and want to make a real impact.




Why Join Us?

✅Work on industry-defining AI solutions with a world-class team.

✅Apply cutting-edge technologies like LLMs, fine-tuning, and generative AI to real-world challenges.

✅A highly competitive, tax-free salary with exceptional benefits.

✅Full relocation to Abu Dhabi, including visa sponsorship for you and your family, educational allowance for children, private healthcare, and an extra flight home every year.

✅One-month extra salary in your first month to help you settle in.




What You’ll Do

✅ Develop and deploy ML models that power next-gen AI solutions.

✅ Work with LLMs, RAG, LangChain, Weaviate, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, and other cutting-edge ML tools.

✅ Solve real-world challenges across multiple industries using AI.

✅ Collaborate with top AI minds in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.




What We’re Looking For

✅ 5+ years of experience in Machine Learning, AI, or Data Science.

✅ Strong hands-on experience with LLMs, deep learning, and generative AI.

✅ Master’s or Ph.D. in AI, Data Science, Computer Science, or related fields.

✅ Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

✅ Experience competing in Kaggle, ACM/ICPC, IOI/NOI, or other coding challenges is a plus!




If this sounds interesting, apply now and let’s build the future of AI together!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We’re seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you’ll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.
Show more

  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?




Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.




We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.




We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.







What we offer:

Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Show more

Title: Junior Developer (Python)
Description:
Squareflow is a growing company founded in 2020 by entrepreneurs (just like you). We embrace technology to create business value with Odoo as an enabler. We believe that any business can be digital first.




To strengthen our team, we are looking for junior developer. As a developer, you'll be in regular contact with clients and our teams in order to deliver solutions based on understanding of their specific needs in terms of business business/IT alignment.




Function:




As a junior developer, your specific tasks and responsibilities may include:




Develop solutions for our clients from many different industries, sectors and company size
Support and maintain those specific solutions
Implement the client's needs in the Odoo solution before configuring it
Create training material and documentation for Odoo users
Deliver informative, well-organized demos to business teams
Accompany and train end-users to the new tool (train the trainer approach) on Odoo and related applications
Develop and maintain processes to continuously monitor data quality
Coordinate test execution to ensure that all technical customizations and configurations follow industry and delivery best practices
Contribute to the daily development of Squareflow




Your profile :




Bachelor or Master degree (preferably in business, engineering or computer science)
Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
Structural thinking
Ability to learn and evolve quickly
Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.




We offer:

A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
The possibility to follow regular trainings
The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions




Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We’re building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way – slow, manual, and disconnected – no longer works.

Some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies – like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io – trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you’ll do

We’re in a rare position. We’ve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now – but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We’re looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn’t about just moving tickets. It’s about solving complex, high-impact problems – owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:


Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
Solve complex machine learning challenges – especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality – using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
Serve as the team’s AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
Advocate for our work externally – writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.


This is a great fit if you…


Are an experienced backend engineer who’s built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era – especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
Have AI observability experience. AI isn’t just about shipping features that sound great – it’s about knowing, conclusively, if they’re making things better.
Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact – not as a gimmick.
Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.


This won’t be the right role if you…


Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who’s applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex – we’re AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
Struggle with ambiguity. We’re an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive – not what’s trendy. (Postgres is great.)
Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we’re a startup – this is a different kind of opportunity.


Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: £75K - £130K


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Wat houdt deze vacature in?

“Data is the new electricity” stelt onze CEO, het brengt een heuse revolutie teweeg. KBC wil binnen de financiële sector dé referentie zijn op het vlak van data analytics en AI. We willen een datagedreven organisatie zijn. Als lid van het data science team zit je aan de kern van onze strategie.

Samen ontwikkelen we AI- en ML-oplossingen die onze business transformeren. We werken daarvoor onder meer met data science platformen als HDFS, Spark en AWS.

Versterk jij dit team, dan kan je ervan op aan dat je impact zal maken. We zullen data op een betere manier gebruiken, onze klanten beter begrijpen en onze processen en risico’s beter beheren. Is dat iets waar jij mee je schouders onder wil zetten?

Wat verwachten we van jou?


Je ontwikkelt AI-/ML-oplossingen die onze business transformeren. Om die uit te rollen en te onderhouden werk je nauw samen met je collega’s bij IT.
Je blijft up to date over data science en AI.
Je zorgt mee voor een sterkere basis binnen KBC Groep op het vlak van kennis en technologie.
Je netwerkt met mogelijke academische en commerciële partners om partnerships op te zetten.
Je leidt E2E data science projecten, inclusief stakeholder management en communicatie en het ondersteunen van junior data scientists;


Jouw troeven?


Je hebt een masteropleiding met minstens 2 jaar ervaring in data scienceof je hebt een doctoraatin econometrie, actuariële wetenschappen, wiskunde, toegepaste wetenschappen, computerwetenschappen, statistiek, fysica of een vergelijkbare discipline.
Je communiceert vlot in het Engels. Zo lukt het je bijvoorbeeld om een AI-oplossing helder uiteen te zetten naar het management toe. Kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans is een pluspunt.
Je hebt ervaring met data analytics en gaat vlot om met de gangbare tools voor statistische analyse en machine learning en (generatieve) AI.
Dankzij jouw inzicht in learning algorithms, strategieën om data te verwerken, machine learning en natural language processing weet je hoe je deze kan implementeren in een business context.
Je bent sterk met Python en data science toolsets (pandas, scikit-learn of H2O, Hugging Face etc). Heb je ook enige ervaring met één of meerdere van deze zaken, dan is dat een meerwaarde:
learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch of Keras)
big data analyses via cloud computing (AWS of MS Azure)
Apache Spark, Hadoop, Kubernetes
Cloudera
Git
Heb je al ervaring met data science in een business context, dan spitsen we helemaal onze oren. Maar ook als je die ervaring niet hebt leren we je graag kennen. Vooral je motivatie vinden we belangrijk.


Wat hebben we je te bieden?


Je werkt samen met een uitzonderlijk team data science professionals: mensen met verschillende culturele achtergronden, die zowel in het onderwijs als in hun professionele loopbaan verschillende paden bewandeld hebben. Die diversiteit verrijkt ons team.
Onze digitale assistente Kate en beleggingsassistent Matti zijn bekenden bij onze klanten. Jij helpt deze virtuele assitenten om mee te groeien met onze ambities. Je werkt met andere woorden aan impactvolle, strategische projecten.
Naast on-the-job learning investeren we in jou met een uitzonderlijk aanbod opleidings- en ontwikkelingskansen. Je wordt aangemoedigd om te blijven groeien als persoon en professioneel. Er zijn concrete pistes om door te groeien binnen KBC.
Je krijgt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief loon. Je kan ook kiezen uit een waaier aan extralegale voordelen.
Onze werkplekken zijn vlot bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Ook los van de coronamaatregelen kan je deels thuiswerken, als je dat wil.
Dankzij flexibele werkuren kan je je werk en je privéleven op elkaar afstemmen.


Klinkt dit als de perfecte match voor jou? Aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren en jouw motivatiebrief in het Engels te schrijven.
Show more

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Senior AI/ML Engineer to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?


Integration and maintenance of software applications or services in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in different technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs (KG) or Graph Data Science (GDS)
Market studies and technical evaluation of advanced commercial or open-source products or services in the above fields
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data
Prompt engineering on Large Language Models and validation of results with the business/policy officers
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Interact with different stakeholders to understand business and data needs, turn them into use cases, prototypes or statements of work.
Support of the solution acceptance process
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality, integrity and performance
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Design the IT architecture and hosting solutions and coordinate its implementation considering cloud technologies, containers, DevOps
Contributing to the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT requirements


Requirements

What do you need to succeed in this position?


Master's degree in IT/ Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent with specialisation in artificial intelligence and minimum 11 years of relevant experience
At least 8 years of experience in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.)
At least 8 years of experience with machine learning techniques, systems lifecycle and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.
At least 8 years of experience in Large Language Models prompt engineering
Minimum of 7 years experience with query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction.
Minimum of 5 years experience with data management and analytics over big datasets, including data quality, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, data visualisation and data retrieval tools
At least 5 years of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc
Minimum of 5 years experience with AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms
At least 5 years experience with applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc
Experience with software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP


Desirable{​{:}


}Certification in AWS Machine Learnin
gCertification in Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate SAS Professional AI and Machine Learnin


gAt Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at for more information.
Show more

  • At least 8 years of experience in Large Language Models prompt engineering
  • Minimum of 7 years experience with query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction.
  • Minimum of 5 years experience with data management and analytics over big datasets, including data quality, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, data visualisation and data retrieval tools
  • At least 5 years of NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc
  • Minimum of 5 years experience with AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms
  • At least 5 years experience with applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc
  • Experience with software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP

Desirable{​{:}

  • }Certification in AWS Machine Learnin
  • gCertification in Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate SAS Professional AI and Machine Learnin

gAt Uni Systems, we are providing equal employment opportunities and banning any form of discrimination on grounds of gender, religion, race, color, nationality, disability, social class, political beliefs, age, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristics. Take a look at for more information.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Freelance
Description:
Rejoignez une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique !




Nous recherchons activement un(e) Senior Data Scientist (freelance) pour accompagner une entreprise leader en Belgique dans ses projets de transformation digitale et d’exploitation avancée des données.




Notre partenaire est un acteur clé dans le secteur de la mobilité, reconnu pour son engagement dans la durabilité, l’innovation et l'excellence de ses services.




Basé(e) dans la Région Bruxelloise, vous interviendrez sur des missions à fort impact stratégique, allant de l’analyse exploratoire des données à la mise en place de modèles prédictifs et de solutions d’intelligence artificielle, au service de la performance et de la prise de décisions.




Vos responsabilités :

Exploiter et analyser les données pour identifier des tendances et extraire des insights exploitables.
Concevoir et entraîner des modèles prédictifs et des algorithmes de machine learning pour résoudre des problèmes spécifiques du client.
Utiliser des techniques avancées de statistiques, de modélisation et de science des données pour optimiser la prise de décision.
Collaborer étroitement avec les Data Engineers et les Data Analysts pour assurer la qualité, la structuration et la visualisation des données.
Communiquer les résultats aux équipes métier à travers des rapports, des visualisations interactives et des présentations claires et synthétiques.




Votre profil :

Minimum 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist, avec une expertise en analyse et modélisation avancée.
Solides compétences en statistiques, mathématiques, machine learning et deep learning.
Maîtrise des langages et outils de data science : Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, SQL.
Expertise en visualisation de données avec Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly ou des outils BI.
Une connaissance des architectures cloud et big data (AWS, Azure, GCP, Spark) est un plus.
Capacité à comprendre et résoudre des problématiques complexes, avec une approche analytique et stratégique.
Excellente communication et capacité à traduire des concepts techniques en recommandations claires pour les équipes métier.
Bon niveau de français et d’anglais, permettant une collaboration efficace avec différentes parties prenantes. La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.




Notre offre :

Une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique.
Un contrat freelance dans le cadre d’un projet de longue durée, à fort impact social.
Une rémunération compétitive prenant en compte le niveau d'expertise du candidat ou de la candidate.
Un travail en mode hybride, avec des possibilités de télétravail.




Cette belle opportunité vous intéresse ? N'hésitez plus à postuler car cette annonce ne tardera pas à disparaître ! Notre recherche est urgente.

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Description:
Expert Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium (On-site or Remote)

Contract Type: Long-term EU Institution Project

EU Citizenship Required







Job Description

We are hiring an Expert Data Scientist to lead high-level analytics projects for European institutions. You will be responsible for designing AI-driven strategies, handling large-scale datasets, and driving data innovation within a multidisciplinary team.







Requirements

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Minimum 12 years of experience in ICT, including 6 years in data science
Strong expertise in AI, machine learning, deep learning, and statistical modeling
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
Any recognized data-related certification is accepted
Fluent in English







Offer

The opportunity to work on cutting-edge data projects for EU institutions
A long-term and stable contract
Competitive daily rates







If you meet the above requirements, please send your CV along with your certifications to:

📧 jjahbala@eservicios.indra.es

Title: AI Expert ( NLP, ML)
Description:
Hello,

We are called People More because we treat our employees with respect, but also because the projects we work on are for people and should be easy and pleasant to use. We are technological, but we look at the bigger picture :)

People More has been in existence for over three years and is an offshoot of one of the country's oldest interactive agencies - Insignia. The company is made up of people with a huge client base in the country and abroad, for whom we build projects from scratch (UX, UI, frontend, backend, mobile) or in part. We work directly for our clients and also support our partners in their own solutions. This ensures a wide range of projects and the ability to change! We work with clients all over the world.

For the project that we are working on with our foreign partner, we are looking for AI Expert (NLP / ML)

Your Duties Will Include


Developing and optimizing AI/ML and NLP models using advanced algorithms.
Deploying AI solutions in the cloud and utilizing containerization and version control.
Analyzing, modeling, and processing data, including exploration and segmentation.
Tracking new AI technologies and supporting their integration with IT systems.


Requirements That Must Be Met


At least 5 years of professional experience in AI development, including machine learning and NLP.
Proven expertise in Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Strong command of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, and AI frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage.
Ability to adapt to evolving AI technologies and methodologies.
Hands-on experience in data preparation and cleaning for AI and machine learning models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker) for AI/ML application deployment.
Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is a plus.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (GitHub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g., Data Services, Talend, etc.).
Strong technical proficiency in database design, data modeling, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Relocation to Belgium required
Very good English and Polish


What We Offer


We are open and honest and we solve problems instead of generating them.
Maybe it’s obvious, but we really respect our employees and associates. We used to be software developers, too, and we appreciate that job!
A small team
An international working environment and international projects
Private medical care
Sports card
Training courses
Hybrid work in Belgium


If you are not sure if you meet the requirements, apply—we’ll talk and give you an honest answer.

Why it’s a good idea to work with People More?


If you are not satisfied with your work or your tasks, we’ll find a way out together!
If you get bored, we will offer you a new product and new, fascinating tasks
We will work on your brand together: you will get an opportunity to attend conferences, including as a speaker, and we will help you publish in recognized magazines and online
We will facilitate your access to challenges that are usually difficult to get
At any time, you can talk directly to the board of People More—we talk your language because the company’s founders are software developers and designers!


What does the recruitment process look like?


A friendly remote initial interview
A remote technical talk
The decision to work together!


Salary

230 - 300 zł/h

contract

B2B

Location

Belgium / Brussels
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75
Show more

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op

  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
  • Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
  • Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
  • Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
  • Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
  • Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.

Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?

  • Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
  • We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
  • We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
  • In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
  • Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
  • Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
  • Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!

Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: Data Scientist _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:


Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.


Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:


Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !


Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq: 50260

Title: Senior Data Scientist - McKinsey Transformation
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will work in our McKinsey Transformation Client Capabilities Network in EMEA and will be part of our Wave Transformatics team.

Wave is a McKinsey SaaS product that equips clients to successfully manage improvement programs and transformations. Focused on business impact, Wave allows clients to track the impact of individual initiatives and understand how they affect longer term goals. It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.

Our Transformatics team builds data and AI products to provide analytics insights to clients and McKinsey teams involved in transformation programs across the globe. The current team is composed of data engineers, data scientists and product managers who are spread across several geographies. The team covers a variety of industries, functions, analytics methodologies and platforms – e.g. Cloud data engineering, advanced statistics, machine learning, predictive analytics, MLOps and generative AI.

Your Impact

You will collaborate closely with a team comprising data scientists, data engineers, product developers, and analytics-focused consultants.

You will work on topics such as descriptive analytics, predictive models (e.g., boosted trees), and large language models (LLMs), particularly for segmentation use cases. Additionally, you will design and deliver products that adhere to MLOps best practices, ensuring they are both maintainable and deployable. By doing so, you will help bring advanced analytics capabilities into one of McKinsey’s flagship products, named "Wave". Your work will be the backbone for how McKinsey runs future Transformations, leveraging data science assets, to improve the odds of success for our clients.

In this role, you will be responsible for the following, as the primary focus


Advanced insight generation transforming complex business questions into statically relevant analyses and these analyses into easy to digest insights. Delivering this through well documented and tested pipelines, that allow easy collaboration with other team members.
Upholding technical excellence Together with the tech lead(s) define how to build, maintain and scale our pipelines. Often piloting new technical approaches & automation. Using your business understanding to critically review model results, trends, analyses and classifications.
Coach & help other colleagues Coach & help you peers when needed, we deliver as a team.
Machine learning model development Lead the design and refinement of statistical models, optimization techniques, advanced machine learning, and predictive models
LLM optimization and evaluation Fine-tune and evaluating the performance and efficiency of Large Language Models, leveraging the latest advancements in neural network architectures and machine learning techniques


Your role might also include, as the secondary focus


Design & build creative approaches to further optimize accuracy & reduce cost In addition to optimizing the LLM through prompts and settings, you will design and test alternative approaches, such as pre-filters and non-LLM-based text models, within parallel multi-agent setups.
Build for scale Together with the tech lead(s), you will define how to maintain and scale our LLM classifier pipeline. The classifier pipeline will, in the long term, run as a on-demand batch process, and will, once stable, be refactored with scalability in mind.
Deploying pipelines at scale Although not core to your role, you will be exposed to cloud deployments & orchestration of our pipelines and can shape these if you have an interest in this field.
Expert guidance for client teams You will work closely with global client service teams to deliver high-quality advanced analytics solutions, offering expert guidance to ensure analytical excellence and understanding at client teams.
Knowledge and research You will contribute to influential articles, white papers, and research, positioning the firm as a thought leader in analytics and transformation, with a focus on LLMs and predictive modeling


Your Qualifications and Skills


Familiarity with neural network architectures (Transformers), RAG models, deep learning libraries (TensorFlow/PyTorch) and machine learning libraries (scikit-learn) is a plus
Exposure to extra tooling such as Snowflake, Excel and Tableau is a plus
Experience in leading complex engagements to deploy advanced analytics and data science methods at scale in real world organizations
Programming experience in the following languages Python and SQL 
3+ years of relevant experience with classical descriptive statistics, standard statistical modelling (e.g. advanced regressions, clustering, classification models) and machine learning techniques (e.g. random forest, support vector machines, gradient boosting, XGBoost) 
Strong data translation and presentation skills with the ability to clearly and effectively communicate complex analytical and technical content
MSc or PhD level in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent by experience

  • MSc or PhD level in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or equivalent by experience

Title: Data Scientist H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Vous Aurez La Charge De

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist capable de trouver des solutions innovantes et robustes à l'ensemble des problématiques Data. Gourou de la donnée, vous vous amusez à faire parler les données et à les mettre au service des entreprises. Vous êtes donc à la croisée d'enjeux fonctionnels et stratégiques :


Étudier des données en possession de l’entreprise
Définir et récupérer des données pertinentes à extraire et à traiter en lien avec la production de l’entreprise, la vente ou encore liées aux données clients
Développer des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Élaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entreprise


Vos compétences

En tant que Data Scientist H/F vous maîtrisez :


L'architecture des bases de données décisionnelles (data warehouse)
Les mathématiques appliquées : construire des algorithmes pour améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Les statistiques


Et Vous Disposez


De solides compétences en programmation informatique (Python, R…)
D'une expertise en algorithmie et gestion des bases de données (NoSQL, Cassandra…)
De la connaissance des méthodologies agiles


Votre profil

Diplômé(e) d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université, vous justifiez d'au minimum 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans un contexte projet Data. Rigoureux(se), proactif(ve) et autonome vous restez en veille technologique et êtes force de proposition. Vous êtes capable de prendre de la hauteur et vous adapter aux enjeux du projet.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Show more
