Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
Introduction

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

Applicants Suitable For This Position Should Have


Recently finalised university education (master) or a student currently in the last year of a Master programme, preferably in data science, applied statistics, or related fields. Priority will be given to applicants that combine data science with economics or public policy, either in your studies or in past professional experience.
Experience of programming languages for data manipulation, especially Python, R and SQL.
Some knowledge of modern data science tools and concepts such as git, Github, Visual Studio, environment variables.
Experience and interest in data science techniques such as generative AI and other machine learning techniques.
Interest in widening your skillset beyond data science: we develop fully-rounded analysts who are also capable of applying data science techniques – not just programmers.
Interest in European Commission policies, in particular in science, technology and innovation;
Excellent communication skills in English;
Ability to work independently and as part of a team;
Willingness to learn about new topics, methods, and skills.


The Following Will Be Considered As a Plus


Proficiency in other languages.


Your Responsibilities

Typical tasks may include:


Developing data analysis pipelines;
Applying supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques to mainly text data;
Data wrangling;
Data visualisation;
Reporting results of analysis;
Assist in other tasks such as literature reviews, case studies and other tasks where needed.


Our offer

Skills

The successful candidate will work as a paid intern in our Brussels office. The role provides the opportunity to gain experience in working at the forefront of European policymaking, to develop analytical skills, and to experience a multinational, friendly business environment. Our package includes:


Paid internship
Belgian phone subscription
Monthly allowance for the transportation card
Training and mentoring possibilities
Working in an international company with 12 offices and more than 290 colleagues


Interested? Apply directly

Applicants need to have either EU citizenship or a valid work permit.

For any questions on the recruitment, please contact recruitment_be@technopolis-group.com (reference DSU_INT2025).

Only the short-listed candidates will be contacted.

About Us

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. While evaluation is still at the core of our company, we have over the years built up the know-how to support decision making on a broad range of topics. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We are acquainted with a wide range of quantitative methods and deliver advanced data analytics that is ahead of the curve. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Technopolis is offering a 5-6 months paid internship at our Brussels office.

About This Job

We seek to appoint an enthusiastic intern to gain first-hand insights in applying data science techniques for policy analysis. It is an exciting time to join the growing data science work at Technopolis Group, where we are deploying new tools across our practice to enhance our policy analysis capacity, from generative AI to reproduceable analytical pipelines. You will mainly focus on developing cross-cutting tools and techniques that can be applied across the company, as well as contribute to specific projects.

Your profile

  • Belgian phone subscription

About Us

Technopolis Group started as a consultancy firm for the evaluation of science, technology and innovation. Our experts provide strategy and foresight, manage networks and provide project management support for even the most complex projects. We evaluate policies, evaluate their impact and communicate them effectively to experts and the broader public. We never settle for out-of-the-box solutions but work with our clients to find the approach that best fits their needs.

We work with decision-makers in different levels and fields, from international institutions, such as the European Commission and multilateral development banks, to regional and local authorities. Our clients include universities and R&D centres, network organisations such as business associations, clusters and incubators as well as governments.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Commodity Trading and Risk Management
Description:
Who You'll Work With

As a member of the Commodity Analytics team, you will be based in one of the following offices Brussels, Amsterdam, Madrid or Lisbon. You’ll work closely with McKinsey’s Commodity Trading Service Line to support clients across sectors and geographies.

Commodity Analytics helps commodity producers, processors, buyers, and traders across agriculture/softs, metals, energy, and consumer sectors improve commodity price risk capabilities with cutting-edge data science.

The Commodity Trading Service Line at McKinsey supports clients in commodity trading and risk strategy, trading operations transformation, and trading and risk digitization driven by deep trading experts with hands-on trading experience and advanced analytics assets.

Our Risk Practice supports clients in many different industries facing challenges of developing and implementing tailored concepts for risk.

Your Impact

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Client counterparts span a wide range of audiences and functions from treasury and risk professionals, marketing & sales teams, procurement category managers, to high-level stakeholders (e.g., CFO).

When working internally, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs, from building price forecasting models for commodities markets, to brainstorming and developing new offers and solutions to support future clients. You will also work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

In this role, your work on the team will primarily be in applying advanced analytics to enable better commodity risk management decisions. For example, you might work as the lead in maintaining and expanding existing hedging strategies by re-training existing models through process driven approaches. You might also modify and improve algorithm performance across market regimes, by introducing new features, data sources, and modelling approaches; rapidly identify opportunities for our clients to increase earnings potential and reduce downside risk by back testing various risk management strategies; co-build bespoke tools with client data science teams that tailor machine-learning algorithms to attain an optimal balance of earnings and volatility given clients’ risk appetite and capital constraints; and/or collaborate with and train cross-functional client teams to instill long-lasting capabilities and ensure new decision-making models are embraced by organizations.

As part of McKinsey, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior commodity and risk practitioners, as well as industry players that are shaping the future of commodity markets and trading. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world (once travel resumes). Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest organizations in agribusiness, materials, energy, industrial, and consumer foods sectors around the globe.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Undergraduate degree is required; advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science (especially machine learning), applied mathematics, economics, quantitative finance or engineering is preferred or equivalent practitioner experience
2+ years of commodity markets experience developing trading or hedging strategies (especially physical/cash markets) or price-discovery analysis in basic materials/metals, agriculture, softs, chemicals, plastics or oil & gas preferred
Experience writing clean, efficient Python code involving model development and deployment using state-of-the-art tools and libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, pandas, etc.)
Experience applying advanced analytical and statistical methods to solve business problems involving commodity markets
Ability to explain nuances of commodity markets and complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Experience working with version control (e.g. Git), shell scripting and Agile methodology
Show more

  • Experience working with version control (e.g. Git), shell scripting and Agile methodology

Title: Job | Data Scientist AI Lab | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Grâce au machine learning (ML) et l'intelligence artificielle (IA), vous générez des produits basés sur les data et vous menez à bien les défis opérationnels les plus urgents.

Votre job en deux mots

Vous travaillez dans l'AI Lab au sein d'une équipe jeune, innovante et dynamique pour réaliser des projets d'IA transversaux end-to-end.

Vous utilisez divers types de data, internes et externes, structurées et non structurées, pour améliorer les use cases existants et en lancer de nouveaux. Cela peut se faire pour toutes les activités bancaires et d'assurances : marketing, compliance, fraude, automatisation des processus…

Votre tâche est très variée :


Vous développez/améliorez des modèles de prévision à l’aide de techniques statistiques et du machine learning.
Vous utilisez des large language models ou d'autres modèles d'IA générative pour fournir des solutions concrètes aux besoins commerciaux.
Vous établissez, analysez et interprétez des hypothèses business et vous exploitez des datasets.
Vous recommandez des idées au business à l’aide de visualisations/algorithmes prévisionnels lorsque des data/résultats sont disponibles.
Vous aidez les utilisateurs à comprendre les principes de la science des données et, si nécessaire, vous commentez les comportements du modèle et les actions de correction possibles.



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Chez nous, vous pouvez vous distinguer et révéler le meilleur de vous-même si vous répondez aux critères suivants :

Vous avez un master ou un doctorat en sciences, avec d’excellents résultats universitaires sur le plan technique (économétrie, sciences informatiques, intelligence artificielle, etc.).

Vous êtes expert dans les techniques de machine learning et vous êtes disposé à actualiser cette connaissance. Une connaissance approfondie d’algorithmes tels que Random Forests, Neural Networks et Reinforcement Learning est un must.

Vous avez déjà de l'experience avec l'application des models d'IA générative comme des large language models.

Vous disposez de solides aptitudes de programmation en Python et SQL et vous avez des notions de MLOps & CI/CD.

Vous maîtrisez le français ou le néerlandais et vous avez une connaissance passive de l’autre langue, et de l’anglais.

Grâce à vos compétences narratives et à votre aptitude à visualiser des données, vous êtes capable d’expliquer des analyses complexes à un public profane. Vous disposez d’excellentes capacités de communication écrite et orale au niveau technique et business.

Vous avez soif de connaissances, non seulement pour maîtriser de nouveaux algorithmes et technologies, mais aussi sur le plan interpersonnel. Vous êtes conscient que la valeur de votre travail est synonyme de qualité et d’acceptation et vous tenez à combiner ces deux aspects.

Vous disposez d’une capacité exceptionnelle pour résoudre les problèmes : vous savez qu'une bonne compréhension du problème représente au moins 90% de la solution, vous faites preuve de créativité et de ténacité pour approfondir les problèmes et chercher des solutions.

Vous marquerez encore plus de points si :


Vous êtes bilingue (français/néerlandais).
Vous avez de l’expérience dans le développement de produits data et software, de la conception à la production.
Vous disposez d'une expérience antérieure du Natural Language Processing.
Vous connaissez Spark et les libraries/tools pour les visualisations (comme Plotly/Dash ou React).
Vous avez des notions du cloud, de préférence Azure.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier
Show more

Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :

  • Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
  • Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius
  • Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé
  • Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier

Title: Satellite Data Processing Engineer
Description:
Welcome to Rayference

Rayference is a Brussels-based SME active in research and development for radiative transfer modelling, satellite data processing and advanced retrieval algorithm development based on inverse modelling. We provide expertise in remote sensing data radiometric calibration and apply new metrological concepts to satellite observations dedicated to climate and environment monitoring.




Your role

We are hiring a Satellite Data Processing Software Engineer to support our Earth Observations activities. You will be in charge of developing, maintaining and use a versatile satellite data processing chain for the generation of Essential Climate Variables (ECVs) data sets. You will be asked to perform verification and quality control of the processed data as well as contributing to the design, development and improvements of scientific algorithms.

You will be part of an international team where English is the working language and will present the outcome of your work at European R&D project meetings.




What you bring

University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
1 – 3 years of proven experience of programming in the Python scientific ecosystem (such as NumPy and xarray), C++ (preferably from C++20), and distributed computing (preferably Dask).
Experience in modern development and testing technologies (git, GitLab, CI/CD, Dev Containers).
Basic knowledge of the Linux environment.
Experience in image processing, Earth Observation data processing.
Experience in container technology, especially Docker/Docker-Swarm, is welcome.
Ability to plan your work and to cope with tight schedules and multiple tasks.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).




What makes you stand out

Excellent skills to fulfil the assigned tasks with great level of autonomy and sense of responsibility.
Knowledge of GPU programming.
Good sense of teamwork.
The ability to write accurate and consistent technical documentation and a strong interest for scientific topics such as numerical computing.
Strong motivation to contribute to the development of a young innovative company.
Experience with virtualization-based server operating systems.




What we offer

At Rayference, you will work with a small and international team, in a flexible professional environment. You will have the opportunity to make an impact in addressing important scientific and societal challenges linked to climate monitoring and Earth Observation. You will collaborate with passionate and talented colleagues with whom you will share regular team-bonding activities.




We offer a competitive package and we value work-life balance, this is why we offer a flexible schedule and possibility to telework from abroad. We believe in a long-term vision, supporting our staff in developing their best skills and building a career in this field.




The salary for this role ranges from 3.600€ to 4.100€ gross monthly (50.112€ to 57.072€ annually), depending on experience and qualifications. We offer a range of benefits to support our employees’ well-being, work-life balance, and financial security, such as transportation support, internet and phone connection and teleworking allowance.




How to apply

Please send to recruitment AT rayference.eu:

A cover letter explaining your interest in the position, highlight relevant qualifications and achievements, and including links to examples of relevant prior works;
a detailed CV;
email address and affiliations of 2 references.

Only applications sent to this email address will be considered. All documents shall be provided in English. Any questions related to this position can be sent to the same email address.




Applications from women are encouraged.

Title: PM: Prompt Engineering & Data Science (Brussels-Based)
Description:
About SailPeak

At Sailpeak, we are a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation.




With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.




🤖 About the Role

We are looking for a Prompt Engineer / Data Scientist with 3 years of experience, working on Gen AI tools to improve internal processes.




One of our leading banking clients is leveraging data science across many use cases to create value in crucial projects.




You will spearhead the transformation with tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve employee productivity and efficiency across processes. The use cases can come from Robotics, Compliance, Client Service Centers, Marketing, and Sales (the list keeps growing).




📊 You will:

Design and Create prompts using prompt engineering techniques
Understand business needs to identify cases where Gen AI can be leveraged to add value to our projects
Test and Evaluate the quality and accuracy of the output from your prompts
Train and Educate the rest of the business on the best practices around using GenAI & working on establishing a prompt academy (learning environment)
Document and Share your findings, results, and learnings with the rest of the business




📊 You bring to the table:

Experience working with Gen AI tools: ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, and Microsoft Office CoPilot
Expertise in Advance Prompt Engineering from designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts
Independence and ability to plan your own work based on project requirements
Strategic thinking around aligning the current business needs and gaps in processes
Experience working with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Business, Product, etc.)
Stakeholder management (being able to communicate with various different stakeholders, managing roadblocks and frustrations, etc.)




🗣️ Language Skills

Fluency in English, French, and/or Dutch




🤹 Other Skills

Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a great plus for us.
We are looking for proactive problem-solvers
You’ll be working independently & autonomously
Passion for growing, building, and continuous learning, especially around the developments within AI and Data Science
Working with cross-functional teams with different business needs, requirements, and challenges




🎁 What’s in it for you

💸 A competitive salary and benefits package.

🦾 Working on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients, in a startup environment

💿 Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.

🫂 Mentorship from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.




🧑‍🔬 The Process

Step 1: 30-minute call with our Head of Talent (Peter): focusing on your current situation, motivation, experience, and practicalities
Step 2: 30-minute call with one of our Founders (Stjepan or Nico): deep-dive into your experience
Step 3: Onsite Business Case with our team
Step 4: Offer!




Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak?




To apply for this role, kindly send your CV or reach out to careers@sailpeak.com




Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

HTML:
About SailPeak

At Sailpeak, we are a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation.


With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.


🤖 About the Role

We are looking for a Prompt Engineer / Data Scientist with 3 years of experience, working on Gen AI tools to improve internal processes.


One of our leading banking clients is leveraging data science across many use cases to create value in crucial projects.


You will spearhead the transformation with tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve employee productivity and efficiency across processes. The use cases can come from Robotics, Compliance, Client Service Centers, Marketing, and Sales (the list keeps growing).


📊 You will:

  • Design and Create prompts using prompt engineering techniques
  • Understand business needs to identify cases where Gen AI can be leveraged to add value to our projects
  • Test and Evaluate the quality and accuracy of the output from your prompts
  • Train and Educate the rest of the business on the best practices around using GenAI & working on establishing a prompt academy (learning environment)
  • Document and Share your findings, results, and learnings with the rest of the business


📊 You bring to the table:

  • Experience working with Gen AI tools: ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, and Microsoft Office CoPilot
  • Expertise in Advance Prompt Engineering from designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts
  • Independence and ability to plan your own work based on project requirements
  • Strategic thinking around aligning the current business needs and gaps in processes
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Business, Product, etc.)
  • Stakeholder management (being able to communicate with various different stakeholders, managing roadblocks and frustrations, etc.)


🗣️ Language Skills

Fluency in English, French, and/or Dutch


🤹 Other Skills

  • Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a great plus for us.
  • We are looking for proactive problem-solvers
  • You’ll be working independently & autonomously
  • Passion for growing, building, and continuous learning, especially around the developments within AI and Data Science
  • Working with cross-functional teams with different business needs, requirements, and challenges


🎁 What’s in it for you

💸 A competitive salary and benefits package.

🦾 Working on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients, in a startup environment

💿 Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.

🫂 Mentorship from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.


🧑‍🔬 The Process

  • Step 1: 30-minute call with our Head of Talent (Peter): focusing on your current situation, motivation, experience, and practicalities
  • Step 2: 30-minute call with one of our Founders (Stjepan or Nico): deep-dive into your experience
  • Step 3: Onsite Business Case with our team
  • Step 4: Offer!


Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak?


To apply for this role, kindly send your CV or reach out to careers@sailpeak.com


Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Title: Job | Data Scientist AI Lab | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

Door machine learning (ML) en artificiële intelligentie (AI) te gebruiken genereer je datagestuurde producten en breng je de meest urgente zakelijke uitdagingen tot een goed einde.

De job in een notendop

Je werkt in het AI Lab binnen een jong, vernieuwend en dynamisch team om transversale AI-projecten end-to-end te realiseren.

Je gebruikt diverse soorten data – interne en externe, gestructureerde en ongestructureerde – om bestaande use cases te verbeteren en nieuwe use cases op te starten. Dat kan voor alle bank- en verzekeringsactiviteiten: marketing, compliance, fraude, procesautomatisering…

Wat je doet, is heel divers:


Je bouwt/verbetert voorspellende modellen met behulp van statistische technieken en machine learning.
Je gebruikt large language models of andere generatieve AI modellen om concrete oplossingen te bieden voor business-noden.
Je maakt, analyseert en interpreteert businesshypotheses en benut datasets.
Je beveelt de business ideeën aan wanneer er data/resultaten beschikbaar zijn aan de hand van visualisaties/voorspellende algoritmes.
Je helpt gebruikers om inzicht te verwerven in de principes van datawetenschap en je licht indien nodig de gedragingen van het model en mogelijke corrigerende acties toe.



Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel één worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:


Een master of doctoraat in de wetenschappen met uitstekende academische resultaten op technisch gebied (econometrie, computerwetenschappen, artificiële intelligentie, e.a.).
Deskundigheid op het vlak van machine learning technieken en bereidheid om die kennis up-to-date te houden; een diepgaande kennis van algoritmes zoals Random Forests, Neural Networks en Reinforcement Learning is hierbij een must.
Ervaring met het toepassen van Generative AI modellen zoals large language models.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden in Python en SQL en noties van MLOps & CI/CD.
Uitgebreide kennis van Nederlands of Frans, met passieve kennis van de andere taal, en Engels.
Ervaring in het verklaren van complexe analyses aan een niet-technisch publiek aan de hand van je verhalende competenties en je capaciteit om data te visualiseren; je beschikt over uitmuntende mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatievaardigheden op technisch en businessniveau.
Honger naar kennis, niet alleen om nieuwe algoritmes en technologieën te beheersen, maar ook op interpersoonlijk vlak; je bent je ervan bewust dat de waarde van jouw werk neerkomt op kwaliteit x acceptatie en je wilt sleutelen aan beide aspecten.
Uitzonderlijke probleemoplossende vaardigheden: je weet dat het juiste inzicht in een probleem minstens 90% van de oplossing uitmaakt, je geeft blijk van creativiteit en volharding bij het doorgronden van problemen en het zoeken van oplossingen.



Je scoort extra met:


Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans).
Ervaring met het bouwen van data- en softwareproducten, van ontwerp tot productie.
Eerdere ervaring met Natural Language Processing.
Kennis van Spark en libraries/tools voor visualisatie (zoals Plotly/Dash of React).
Noties van cloud, bij voorkeur Azure.



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carrièrekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-privé balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Title: Software Engineer Python Senior H/F
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous,
Ingénieux, votre imagination débordante vient à bout de chaque problématique,
Force de proposition, vous êtes le roi des nouvelles idées pour améliorer les projets,
Bon communiquant, vous êtes adepte des formations, des feedbacks… de tous types d’échanges en fait.


Ensuite quoi

Au sein d'une équipe dynamique, vous serez amené à :


Prendre en compte les spécifications fonctionnelles, analyser, définir le problème et les exigences
Concevoir la solution technique et créer de nouvelles applications (web, services, APIs) en sélectionnant les frameworks appropriés
Estimer la charge de travail
Développer (et faire les tests unitaires) en respectant les bonnes pratiques de code, et documenter
Maintenir les services existants et assurer leur fiabilité
Rapporter l'avancée des tâches et actions de façon hebdomadaire
Assurer et garantir la livraison, et le respect des deadlines
Collaborer et partager son expérience avec d'autres équipes


Profil recherché


Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5) :
Vous justifiez d'une expérience de 5 ans minimum réussie en développement,
Vous disposez d’une maîtrise du langage Python et Flask, et libraries comme Pandas, FastAPI et Dash,
Vous disposez d’une connaissance en développement front-end avec Angular ou React,
Vous disposez d'une connaissance DevOps, incluant compréhension et expérience avec Jenkins, Azure DevOps et Kubernetes,
Vous êtes familier avec les plateformes cloud comme AWS et Azure,
Vous avez l’esprit créatif qui vous permet de proposer des solutions innovantes,
Vous parlez couramment anglais


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en France ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: React Developer
Description:
We're working with a leading Saas company in supply chain optimization in Brussels. They're currently building out a brand-new tech team and they’re looking for a React Developer to join them on a permanent basis.




You’ll play a key role in designing and building high-performing user interfaces for a modern supply chain platform. You’ll work closely with back-end developers, product managers, and UX/UI designers to create a responsive and efficient application.




Responsibilities:

Build and maintain scalable React components.
Develop new user-facing features with a focus on performance.
Work in an Agile environment, participating in code reviews and mentoring juniors.
Integrate APIs and ensure a smooth, intuitive user experience.
Stay up-to-date with the latest React and front-end development trends.




Your Profile:

Strong experience with React.js and JavaScript/TypeScript.
Familiarity with state management libraries (e.g., Redux or Zustand).
Experience with RESTful APIs and component-based architecture.
Knowledge of front-end build pipelines and tools (Webpack, Babel, etc.).
Being a team player and being able to communicative effectively.




The Offer:

Be part of a brand-new team and help shape their technical direction.
Work on large-scale products with real-world impact on global supply chains.
3 days remote work and a choice of 2 Brussels-based offices.
Between €3,200-€6,000 depending on experience and interview process.
Chance to progress into a Team Lead in the short to medium term.

Title: Applied AI Research Scientist
Description:
Company Overview

We are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $50M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. We have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Our technology is based on 15 years of research by our founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device giving us commercial access to 43 countries worldwide.

High blood pressure is the world's most common disease and causes 18M deaths/year. At Aktiia, we believe that our novel technology is the key to building the fundamental datasets for the next chapter of understanding and discovery in the field of blood pressure. Before Aktiia, it was not possible to do this at scale. To strengthen our team, we are looking for a:

APPLIED AI RESEARCH SCIENTIST

Responsibilities


Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems



Your profile


M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Strong publication record in Machine Learning or AI
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Motivated, proactive, and curious, with a structured, solution-oriented mindset; a team player eager to learn
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit


Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches? In this case you are ready to rock with Aktiia team. We look forward to receiving your application by email (18DA2655CC@jobs.workablemail.com).

Only fully documented applications (CV, diplomas) will be considered for the recruitment process. If you should not hear back from us within two weeks, your application has unfortunately not been successful for this role.

  • 2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques
  • Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
  • Strong publication record in Machine Learning or AI
  • Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
  • Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
  • Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
  • Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
  • Motivated, proactive, and curious, with a structured, solution-oriented mindset; a team player eager to learn
  • Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
  • Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
  • Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit

Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches? In this case you are ready to rock with Aktiia team. We look forward to receiving your application by email (18DA2655CC@jobs.workablemail.com).

Only fully documented applications (CV, diplomas) will be considered for the recruitment process. If you should not hear back from us within two weeks, your application has unfortunately not been successful for this role.

Title: Developer Python / MLops
Description:
Infomaniak, c’est 30 ans de savoir-faire et plus de 250 passionné·e·s, avec une ambition commune : créer un cloud éthique sans compromis sur l’écologie, la vie privée et l’humain.

Nous créons des data centers qui sont à la pointe de l’innovation écologique et nous développons des services IaaS, PaaS et SaaS entièrement hébergés et développés en Suisse pour le B2B et le B2C. Nos solutions comprennent une suite d’applications collaboratives en ligne et des solutions d’hébergement cloud, de streaming, de marketing et d’événementiel.

Avec des millions d’utilisateurs et la confiance d’organisations publiques et privées dans toute l’Europe — telles que la RTBF, les Nations Unies, des banques centrales, plus de 3’000 radios et TV, et de nombreuses métropoles et organismes de sécurité — Infomaniak est une entreprise indépendante, engagée pour l’indépendance technologique en Europe, l’économie locale et un numérique plus soutenable pour la planète.

Es-tu prêt


e à rejoindre une entreprise en pleine croissance, à donner le meilleur de toi-m****ême et à grandir avec nous afin de contribuer au développement d’une alternative éthique aux géants du Web ? Alors, nous avons h****âte de te rencontrer !


Nous Recherchons Un·e

Developer Python / MLops

Tes Responsabilités

Intégrer une des équipes en charge du développement et la maintenance de plusieurs produits et projets. De grandes nouveautés sont en préparation, tu seras amené à :


bâtir, en équipe, le futur de l’hébergemen****t chez infomaniak.
développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités pour ces produits, ainsi que d’en assurer la maintenance et la qualité.


Le Profil Qui Nous Fait Vibrer


Tu es parfaitement à l’aise avec Python , Kubernetes / Docker, Grafana / Prometheus, Elastic , Git , Automatisation (CI/CD) , API Rest etc.
La qualité du code que tu écris est primordiale
La sécurité, et les performances sont au centre de tes préoccupations
L’échange et le code review te sont familiers
Un si tu as des connaissances en :
Rust/C
Connaissances Machine Learning (LLM, VLLM, Hugging face)
Fast API
Automatisation sur Gitlab
Open source / Side project
Tu aimes travailler en équipe, et fais preuve d’une communication positive
Ton humour, ta flexibilité et ton esprit d’équipe sont des atouts indispensables pour travailler dans le fun
Un niveau C2 en français ainsi qu’un niveau B2 en anglais te seront nécessaires pour faciliter ton intégration (documentation technique)


La stack technique que l’on utilise


Python
Docker / Kubernetes
Grafana / Prometheus
Sentry / ElasticSearch
Gitlab


Le Poste


Contrat à durée indéterminée
Taux d’occupation : 80 - 100%
Localisation : Genève
Disponibilité : Au plus vite


Les Étapes Du Processus De Recrutement


Un premier entretien technique pour valider tes compétences.
Un second entretien dans nos bureaux


Pourquoi Infomaniak


Fais partie d’une entreprise qui façonne un cloud éthique qui respecte la vie privée, l’humain et l’environnement.
Travaille chaque jour dans un cadre bienveillant, équilibré avec ta vie personnelle et extrêmement stimulant avec des personnes à la pointe de leur domaine qui sont engagées, à l’écoute et passionnées par ce qu’elles font.
Fais une véritable différence dans la vie de millions d’utilisateurs à travers le monde. Chez Infomaniak, nous sommes tous réunis par la sensation d’avoir de réelles responsabilités et de contribuer à quelque chose de plus grand.
Rencontre des personnes diversifiées dans un climat convivial lors de sorties d’entreprise très régulières (Afterwork, ski, sortie vélo, théâtre, etc.).
Évolue dans un climat très agréable et dans un cadre de travail original, où les salles de réunion sont décorées avec soin et qui favorisent l’inspiration ainsi que la collaboration.
Profite de nombreux autres avantages comme une prime annuelle incitant à la mobilité douce, une salle de fitness pour te maintenir en forme, la mise à disposition de vélos et trottinettes électriques, des espaces de détente conviviaux (salle de repos, jeux vidéos et d’arcade, flipper, babyfoot, etc.), une excellente couverture accident et perte de gain, et d’autres surprises encore.


Pour que ta candidature soit prise en compte, écris-nous en 10 lignes (sans l’IA) pourquoi ce poste chez Infomaniak te pla****ît et ferait sens pour toi.

Chez Infomaniak, nous nous engageons en faveur de la diversité, de l’équité et de l’inclusion des collaborateurs·trices sur le lieu de travail. Nos offres d’emploi sont ouvertes à tous·tes et tous les dossiers de candidatures sont évalués sur un pied d’égalité, qu’importe le genre, l’origine, la religion, l’orientation sexuelle ou le handicap des candidat·e·s.

Benefits and advantages

Ta vie privée et ton temps sont précieux

Toutes tes heures sont payées. Tes heures supplémentaires sont récupérées et le congé paternité est de 3 semaines (au lieu des 2 semaines prévues par la loi).

Télétravail et horaires flexibles

Nous pensons qu’il est indispensable d'avoir des équipes soudées et proches les unes des autres, et tout est fait pour que chacun(e) se sente bien sur son lieu de travail. Jusqu’à 2 jours de télétravail sont possibles pour les personnes qui ont besoin de plus de souplesse.

Travailler sérieusement, mais avec du fun

Il y a très régulièrement des sorties originales qui te permettent de découvrir des activités et de rire avec tes collègues.

Tu aimes la planète ? Nous aussi

Selon ton moyen de transport pour te rendre au travail, tu profites d’une prime allant jusqu’à CHF 1500 par an.

Ton revenu est assuré en cas de maladie

Si tu es malade et que tu ne peux pas travailler, Infomaniak dépasse les exigences de la loi et tu reçois 100% de ton salaire.

Nous pensons à ton futur

Notre caisse de pension est éthique et Infomaniak dépasse les exigences de la loi pour ta retraite (salaires LPP déplafonnés).

La santé est ce que nous avons de plus précieux

Chez Infomaniak, tu es couvert par une Assurance Accident Complémentaire Privée (LAAC). Tu reçois les meilleurs soins dans les meilleures conditions possibles en cas d’accident.

Apply on Jobup

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Logmind is a dynamic and innovative startup based in Lausanne, Switzerland, specializing in cloud-based AIOps solution. Our platform automatically detects issues within an organization's application and infrastructure logs and alert data, enabling IT teams in large enterprises to proactively identify and resolve technical problems in complex IT environments.




We are looking for an entrepreneurial and collaborative team member with hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and software engineering.




Your qualifications & competencies:

MSc or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related fields.
Expertise in modern programming languages and analytics tools such as Python, Scala, Kafka, Spark, Elasticsearch, etc.
Expertise in data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures (e.g., GPT, BERT, or similar models).
Motivated and passionate about large-scale machine learning problems, with the ability to think big and execute effectively.
Good communication skills - ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
Relevant IT industry experience would be a plus.




Your responsibilities:

Design, prototype, and develop advanced algorithms for processing time-series text and metric data.
Implement, test, and optimize proposed algorithms for large-scale environments, ensuring efficiency and scalability with real-time data streams.
Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed methods into the core platform.
Analyze large datasets to uncover insights, improve detection accuracy and refine model performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, deep learning, and observability to drive continuous innovation.




Advantages of working with us:

Unique career development and growth opportunities
Work with a friendly, motivated and talented team
Opportunity to have a real impact and to make a difference for both customers and the internal team
Work in a fast-growing and innovative start-up environment from the office at EPFL Innovation Park.




We offer full-time positions based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Thus, you have to be eligible to work and live in Switzerland.

Title: Data Scientist in GenAI, 80-100%
Description:
At Unique, we leverage generative AI to transform the financial services industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the financial sector by enhancing efficiency and driving growth. Our LLM-agnostic platform offers ready-to-use financial agents for wealth management, investment banking, and private equity. Unique is a market leader in providing generative AI solutions for financial institutions serving over 40 clients globally.




We are looking for a Data Scientist in GenAI who is passionate about exploring the latest trends in AI, researching new technologies, and enabling the development of AI-driven solutions. You will be part of the core team responsible for providing tooling and insights to the pruduct teams.

Responsibilities




Researching and evaluating the latest trends in GenAI, including state-of-the-art models and tools such as Perplexity, ChatGPT, and other emerging AI innovations
Conducting experiments on new AI tooling and methodologies to assess their feasibility and potential impact
Reverse engineering, reconstructing, and analyzing current AI trends to understand their underlying mechanics
Delegating the implementation of validated tools and solutions to Python engineers for production deployment




What do you need to succeed




PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field with touchpoints in GenAI from a leading technical university such as e.g. ETH Zurich
Hands-on experience with LLM APIs and advanced prompt engineering
Strong research capabilities with the ability to analyze, evaluate, and experiment with new AI technologies
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with engineers and product teams




What we offer / Benefits




Innovative Work Environment 🚀 Engage in groundbreaking projects within the Generative AI space
Culture 🌿 A modern company with flat hierarchies that focuses on a people-oriented culture and places great emphasis on transparency and open communication
Flexibility👩🏻‍💻 in working hours and location
Competitive compensation and investment opportunities 💰
A dog-friendly office in central Zurich 🐶

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist to support our organization. This role combines the responsibilities of data scientist and data analyst, focusing on leveraging statistical techniques and machine learning to optimize business processes and drive informed decision-making. The ideal candidate will work closely with stakeholders across various departments to uncover actionable insights and support our digital transformation efforts.




Main Responsibilities:

Apply expertise in deriving valuable insights from large and complex data sets, including un-structured data using a combination of statistical and computational techniques.
Understand the business operational processes that are the sources of data.
Utilize critical thinking to recognize patterns and trends in data that yield insights on the physical processes represented by the data.
Analyze large data sets to identify patterns and trends, providing clear, actionable insights that inform business strategies and decision-making for management and departmental needs.
Create and maintain data visualizations using tools like Tableau and Power BI to effectively communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Implement data analytics solutions using established relational data models, in alignment with the priorities defined by the team.
Support the transition from manual reporting to automated solutions and enhance digital transformation efforts by promoting data-driven approaches.
Collaborate with Data Engineers and other team members to ensure data is properly collected, stored, and processed for analysis.
Support the organization in addressing ad-hoc data inquiries and deliver valuable insights to various departments.
Apply advanced analytical methods, machine learning, and deep learning algorithms to identify patterns, trends, and insight that help business make informed decisions.
Develop, implement, and evaluate machine learning models to predict outcomes based on historical and live data.
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions, improve outcomes and create predictive models to provide insights that support drive business growth.

Minimum Qualifications/Experience/Skills:

Experience in data analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, Java or R and familiarity with machine learning frameworks.
Strong foundation in statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
Experience with data visualization tools: Tableau, Power BI
Experience with statistical analytical tools and Microsoft stacks.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English for effective collaboration across teams.
Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and address business problems using data insights.
Knowledge of SQL and experience with relational databases is preferred.
Familiarity with Agile and/or Scrum methodologies is a plus.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Major Challenges for this position:

Navigating the complexity of large and diverse data sets to extract meaningful insights.
Balancing multiple stakeholders needs and priorities while delivering timely and accurate analysis.
Keeping up with rapidly evolving technologies and methodologies in data science and analytics.
Ensuring data quality and integrity amid varying data sources and formats.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ref: 533ASISW

Title: Data Scientist - Commodities Trading

Location: Thalwil, Zurich, Switzerland

Salary: Attractive

Date: 11th March 2025




Our client, a leading global financial institution, is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join their team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in quantitative methodologies, eager to develop and enhance analytics solutions that drive commodity management decisions. You will collaborate with digital teams and business stakeholders to identify priorities and optimize workflows, leveraging advanced data science techniques.




Duties Include:




Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities where machine learning can enhance decision-making.
Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning models, including regression, classification, text analysis, and time series forecasting.
Collect, process, analyze, and visualize large structured and unstructured datasets from internal and external sources.
Apply appropriate modeling techniques to generate actionable insights and improve analytics solutions.
Monitor and enhance model performance, expanding scope as needed.
Partner with data engineers to build scalable, repeatable data pipelines, ensuring consistency and robustness in analytics applications.
Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.




The preferred candidate should possess experience in Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

You will collaborate with digital teams and business stakeholders to identify priorities and optimize workflows, leveraging advanced data science techniques.


Duties Include:


  • Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities where machine learning can enhance decision-making.
  • Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning models, including regression, classification, text analysis, and time series forecasting.
  • Collect, process, analyze, and visualize large structured and unstructured datasets from internal and external sources.
  • Apply appropriate modeling techniques to generate actionable insights and improve analytics solutions.
  • Monitor and enhance model performance, expanding scope as needed.
  • Partner with data engineers to build scalable, repeatable data pipelines, ensuring consistency and robustness in analytics applications.
  • Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.


The preferred candidate should possess experience in Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.

At Nexthink, we’re the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!

We’re a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key—we encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we’re looking for!

Are you passionate about AI and eager to turn that enthusiasm into real-world impact? Do you want to learn from experienced AI engineers while working on cutting-edge solutions? If so, this is your opportunity to join Nexthink as a Junior AI Engineer!

As a Junior AI Engineer, you’ll be part of a dynamic and collaborative AI team, gaining hands-on experience in building AI solutions deployed on the cloud with an impact on millions of employees worldwide.

This role offers an incredible opportunity to:


Build your expertise in modern AI technologies (LLM, AI agents, …) and frameworks (Python, Langchain, …)
Learn how to develop scalable and resilient software in a cloud production-environment
Contribute to meaningful projects that impact our customers
Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team where questions are encouraged
Grow your career with mentorship from experienced AI and software engineers


If you're ready to start your journey in AI engineering and are excited about learning while doing so, we want to hear from you!

Even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply. We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as experience!

Qualifications

We're not expecting you to know everything! What we're looking for is:


MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, ML or related field
A solid foundation in AI, ML and software engineering
Genuine curiosity about building cloud product at scale and enthusiasm for solving real-world problems
Strong willingness to learn and adapt
Clear communication skills (English) with technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Consultant
Description:
Our client, a ML Focused consultancy are looking for a German-speaking AI Engineering Consultant to join a fast-growing team in Basel and drive impactful AI transformations! (They also have a several ongoing projects in Zurich)🔥




💡 Why this role?

You’ll be at the forefront of AI & ML adoption, helping organizations design, build & scale ML solutions beyond prototypes. You won’t just write code—you’ll shape AI strategy, implement best practices, and enable teams to unlock the full potential of AI.




🌍 Your impact:

✅ Consult & Engineer: Work with cutting-edge ML, LLMs & Generative AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.

✅ End-to-End AI Operations: Design & optimize data, model & code pipelines (DataOps, MLOps & DevOps).

✅ Technical Leadership: Be a trusted advisor, shape solution blueprints, and drive AI engineering excellence.

✅ Collaboration & Enablement: Work closely with teams to operationalize AI & ensure reliability, scalability, and automation.




🔍 What you bring:

🔹 3+ years of experience in ML, AI, or Software Engineering

🔹 Hands-on expertise in ML models, LLMs, and Data/AI platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.)

🔹 Strong understanding of DataOps, DevOps, and MLOps best practices

🔹 Passion for scaling AI beyond POCs & driving enterprise AI success

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there, future innovator! At Creaitor we’re reshaping the way companies manage their content marketing. Since 2022 we’ve been building the leading AI-driven platform to help businesses streamline their entire content marketing lifecycle. We’re at home in beautiful Lucerne, Switzerland but our growing team mostly works remotly to build amazing AI solutions for customers all over the world.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead our machine learning initiatives working directly with Creaitor's CTO. This role is critical as you will lay the foundation for our ML/AI capabilities and lead the development of innovative solutions that enhance our platform. You will cover both the roles of a Machine Learning Engineer and a Data Scientist, working closely with product managers to build and deploy cutting-edge models that meet the needs of our customers.

Tasks


Lead ML Development: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models.
Strategy and Vision: Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for machine learning initiatives aligned with Creaitor’s goals.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging machine learning to solve complex problems and improve user experience.
Vector Database Management: Set up and manage vector databases to efficiently store and retrieve high-dimensional data, enabling fast and accurate similarity searches.
Data Management: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to inform model development and extract actionable insights.
Feature Engineering: Perform feature engineering to enhance model performance and accuracy.
Model Training: Train and fine-tune machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques.
Model Optimization: Evaluate and optimize model performance to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in machine learning and AI to continuously enhance our platform.
Testing and Maintenance: Implement and maintain robust testing frameworks to ensure the reliability of machine learning solutions.
Documentation: Document processes, models, and methodologies to ensure knowledge sharing and reproducibility.


Requirements


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar. Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
Foundational Knowledge: Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
LLM Expertise: Experience in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI
NLP Expertise: Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and tools.
Vector Databases: Experience in working with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) to store and manage high-dimensional data for similarity searches and recommendation engines.
Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead projects and work independently as well as part of a team.
Communication Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Benefits


Work remotely while being an indispensable member of our global team. You’ll have all the tools at your disposal to fascilitae communication and a great work environment.
Work at the heart of a growing AI startup with a unique culture and ambitions to match your own.
We are result driven and give you the space and flexibility to organize your work as it best suits you.
Get the opportunity to be a co-owner of a successfull startup with Creaitor’s Employee Stock Options Program.
Be part of the initial scaling team and shape the future of Creaitor with us


We’re fresh off of closing our pre-seed financing round and are ready to kick our growth into high gear by welcoming new team members with exceptional talent to grow Creaitor to the preferred AI Content Marketing platform for businesses worldwide. If this sounds exciting to you, apply now!
Show more

We’re fresh off of closing our pre-seed financing round and are ready to kick our growth into high gear by welcoming new team members with exceptional talent to grow Creaitor to the preferred AI Content Marketing platform for businesses worldwide. If this sounds exciting to you, apply now!

Title: AI Researcher (100% Remote)
Description:
Join Tether and Shape the Future of Digital Finance

At Tether, we’re not just building products, we’re pioneering a global financial revolution. Our cutting-edge solutions empower businesses—from exchanges and wallets to payment processors and ATMs—to seamlessly integrate reserve-backed tokens across blockchains. By harnessing the power of blockchain technology, Tether enables you to store, send, and receive digital tokens instantly, securely, and globally, all at a fraction of the cost. Transparency is the bedrock of everything we do, ensuring trust in every transaction.

Innovate with Tether

Tether Finance: Our innovative product suite features the world’s most trusted stablecoin, USDT, relied upon by hundreds of millions worldwide, alongside pioneering digital asset tokenization services.

But that’s just the beginning:

Tether Power: Driving sustainable growth, our energy solutions optimize excess power for Bitcoin mining using eco-friendly practices in state-of-the-art, geo-diverse facilities.

Tether Data: Fueling breakthroughs in AI and peer-to-peer technology, we reduce infrastructure costs and enhance global communications with cutting-edge solutions like KEET, our flagship app that redefines secure and private data sharing.

Tether Education: Democratizing access to top-tier digital learning, we empower individuals to thrive in the digital and gig economies, driving global growth and opportunity.

Tether Evolution: At the intersection of technology and human potential, we are pushing the boundaries of what is possible, crafting a future where innovation and human capabilities merge in powerful, unprecedented ways.

Why Join Us?

Our team is a global talent powerhouse, working remotely from every corner of the world. If you’re passionate about making a mark in the fintech space, this is your opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest minds, pushing boundaries and setting new standards. We’ve grown fast, stayed lean, and secured our place as a leader in the industry.

If you have excellent English communication skills and are ready to contribute to the most innovative platform on the planet, Tether is the place for you.

Are you ready to be part of the future?

About The Job

At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

This role is uniquely positioned to oversee the creation and optimization of AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops. Your leadership will guide our team in pushing the boundaries of AI, making high-performance AI technologies accessible and efficient for personal use while setting new industry standards for innovation and utility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

Title: University Graduate – Junior Data Scientist (Flex-Track) 100% (f/m/d)
Description:
At Julius Baer, we celebrate and value the individual qualities you bring, enabling you to be impactful, to be entrepreneurial, to be empowered, and to create value beyond wealth. Let’s shape the future of wealth management together.

Kick-start your career with Julius Baer’s Graduate Programme in October 2025

Are you about to complete your master’s degree or have recently graduated? Are you ready to embark on a journey that combines passion for wealth management, ambition, and excellence?

Our Flex-Track Graduate Programme is an 18-month journey designed to unleash your full potential, offering three rotations in different teams, including an international assignment. As a Flex-Track Graduate, you are in the driving seat to define your rotations 2 and 3 within all departments of the bank. This unique opportunity will immerse you in Julius Baer’s global network, provide hands-on experience, and lay the foundation for a thriving career in wealth management.

Your team

Join the CRO division and become part of the Analytics & Transformation Team in Zurich. The Analytics & Transformation team provides technical solutions and objective critical thinking to help the Bank manage risks, and address remediation and investigations. We support an array of stakeholders within CRO globally, who turn to us for assistance with quantifying non-financial risk, developing predictive models, implementing new technologies, and deliver financial or economic analyses. During the Graduate Programme, you will have the opportunity to work in three highly skilled, purpose-built teams with experience in analytics, risk, compliance, banking and finance, enabling you to enrich your technical and business knowledge

What you get


An individualised career path with opportunities to become an expert in a chosen field
Dynamic insights by rotating through different teams and international experience
A steep learning curve, driven by demanding and fast-paced rotation tracks
Opportunities to be impactful and make a difference
Strong community and regular individual touchpoints with experienced professionals


Start date: 1 October 2025

Curious to learn more about our Graduate Programme?

Visit our careers website: https://www.juliusbaer.com/en/careers/graduates/

YOUR CHALLENGE

What to work on?


Work with complex data sets, uncovering trends or patterns that can be used to extract valuable insights to be used by Risk and Compliance Officers, senior leaders, and supervisory authorities
Design, build and maintain pragmatic and statistically rigorous solutions to concrete problems raised by our internal clients by leveraging statistical and machine learning methodologies
Work closely with business analysts and CRO teams to answer important risk questions using scientific techniques and research methods
Think creatively, proactively, and innovatively to identify new opportunities within Julius Baer’s long-term roadmap for analytics


What to learn?


Developing and testing robust prescriptive and predictive models that allows the division to deliver on the roadmap for analytics
Collaborate with colleagues and senior leaders globally to implement analytics solutions that create effectiveness and efficiency in various Banking processes
Synthesize data and methodologies into actionable risk monitoring strategies
Communicate effectively, understand, and make visible the value the data and developed solutions provided to the division


YOUR PROFILE


Master's degree from a university or university of applied sciences with above-average grades in a quantitative field (Financial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent) Graduation date no more than 12 months ago
Initial practical experience with dataset analysis and model creation using R or Python
Experience navigating SQL databases
Enthusiastic about leveraging data and statistical knowledge to solve complex problems
Committed researcher, constantly curious, questioning ideas and showing a keen interest in learning about our methods
Team-oriented individual, enjoys collaborating with a diversity of experts, listening to different ideas, and voicing their own to deliver the best possible outcome
A global mindset, excellent interpersonal skills, and a strong appetite for learning
Fluency in English, with additional languages being a plus
Eligibility to work in the country where you apply for the position


We are looking forward to receiving your full job application through our online application tool. Further interesting job opportunities can be found on our Career site.

Is this not quite what you are looking for? Set up a job alert by creating a candidate account here.
Show more
